Context.Comment: Enable this context for the peripheral(s) you want to use as boot device(s): this will restrain the pins choices to the ones recognized by the ROM code.
Context.Name: BootROM

Context.Comment: Enable this context for the peripheral(s) you want to use in TF-A BL2: this will limit the size of the device tree generated for TF-A BL2.
Context.Name: BootLoader

Context.Comment: Enable this context for the peripheral(s) you want to use in OP-TEE secure OS.
Context.Name: CortexA7S

Context.Comment: Enable this context for the peripheral(s) you want to use in Linux OS.Notice that the selected peripherals are also enabled in U-Boot device tree.
Context.Name: CortexA7NS

Context.Comment: Enable this context for the peripheral(s) that you want to use in STM32Cube running on the Cortex-M coprocessor.
Context.Name: CortexM4
